title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The current implementation of BidiUtil in win32 has a line that uses Class.forName() to instantiate a Callback object.
EB: The suggested solution is to add a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. Since there are no nonstatic methods in this class, it would be a good practice to prevent people from instantiating the class unnecessarily. Adding a private constructor does not increase the size of the class, as the compiler generates a free public constructor by default.
SR: To reproduce the issue, verify or use jxeLink or a similar tool. Observe that the method using Class.forName() throws a NoClassDefFoundError, which is not defined in the CLDC class libraries.
